City Commission

The Brownsville City Commission is comprised of seven members made up of the Mayor and six City Commissioners. You can write to your Mayor and Commissioner at: P.O. Box 911, Brownsville, Texas 78520.

The City Commission meets at the City Commission Chambers located at City Hall/Old Federal Building, 2 Floor, 1001 E. Elizabeth St., Brownsville, TX 78520

  1. John Cowen, Jr.

    Mayor John.Cowen@brownsvilletx.gov Phone: 956-548-6007

    1001 E. Elizabeth Street Brownsville, TX  78520

    • Elected:  May 6, 2023
    • Sworn In: May 16, 2023
    • Term Expires: May 2027

  1. Tino Villarreal, Jr.

    City Commissioner, At-Large "A" Email Phone: 956-548-6007
    • Elected:  June 17, 2023
    • Sworn In: July 11, 2023
    • Term Expires: May 2027

  1. Nurith Galonsky

    City Commissioner, At-Large "B" Email Phone: 956-548-6007
    • Elected: June 2025
    • Sworn In: June 17,  2025
    • Term Expires: May 2029

  1. Bryan L. Martinez

    City Commissioner, District 1 Email Phone: 956-548-6007
    • Elected: May 6, 2023
    • Sworn In: May 16, 2023
    • Term Expires: May 2027

  1. Linda C. Macias

    City Commissioner, District 2 Email Phone: 956-548-6007
    • Elected:  May 6, 2023
    • Sworn In:  May 16, 2023
    • Term Expires:  May 2027

  1. Gustavo De León

    City Commissioner, District 3 Email Phone: 956-548-6007
    • Elected:  May 3, 2025
    • Sworn In:  May 13, 2025
    • Term Expires:  May 2029

  1. Pedro Cardenas

    City Commissioner, District 4 Email Phone: 956-548-6007
    • Elected: June 2025
    • Sworn In: June 17, 2025
    • Term Expires: May 2029

Special meetings or workshops may be called by the City Commission as needed. For further information contact us at 956-548-6042.

  • 1st and 3rd Tuesday of each month
  • City Hall / Federal Building 1001 E Elizabeth Street Commission Chambers, 2nd Floor Brownsville, TX 78520

The Office of the City Secretary coordinates Brownsville City Commission meetings.

The office of the City Secretary prepares agendas, meeting packets, and approved minutes.

City Commission agendas are posted on the City's website on the afternoon of the Friday prior to the scheduled Tuesday meeting.
